page.title: 10LOCAL INDUSTRIES.
page.content:
{VARDOC FABRICS}is a small woollen tie factory at the end of the picturesque} Church Lane in{Old Marston Village.} Although there are{no}other branches of the firm in the country, this one alone manages to distribute all over Europe. The twenty staff, who start work as early as{5:00am,}weave the wool on their looms, cut it to size and sew in a lining. The finished products are incredibly popular{(100,000}of them are sold each year), so the business continues to thrive.
{STONESHIRE LTD, Headington,}a building firm and{UNICOL ENGINEERING, Old} {Marston,}an audio-visual manufacturing firm, are two small factory units providing employment for some local people.
